com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBAdminDatabase

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBAdminDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBConstants, DBConstantsMySQL, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DBAdminDerbyDatabase
public class DBAdminDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBConstants, DBConstantsMySQL

This class is responsible for creating and accessing the administration database that Compendium uses for maintaining the list of user created database and global system properties. For MYSQL Databases

See Also:

Constructor Detail

DBAdminDatabase

public DBAdminDatabase(IServiceManager service)
Constructor, which stores the ServiceManager and DatabaseManager references and asks the DatabaseManager to open a new project for the administration database.

Parameters:
IServiceManager - service, a reference to an instance of a ServiceManager object.

DBAdminDatabase

public DBAdminDatabase(IServiceManager service,
                       java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                       java.lang.String sDatabasePassword)
Constructor, which stores the ServiceManager and DatabaseManager references and asks the DatabaseManager to open a new project for the administration database. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when accessing the MySQL database and uses 'localhost' as the address.

Parameters:
IServiceManager - service, a reference to an instance of a ServiceManager object.
sDatabaseName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the MySQL database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the MySQL database

DBAdminDatabase

public DBAdminDatabase(IServiceManager service,
                       java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                       java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                       java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
Constructor, which stores the ServiceManager and DatabaseManager references and asks the DatabaseManager to open a new project for the administration database. This constructor also takes a name and password to use when accessing the MySQL database, and the IP address of the MysqL server machine.

Parameters:
IServiceManager - service, a reference to an instance of a ServiceManager object.
sDatabaseName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the MySQL database
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the MySQL database
sDatabaseIP, - the IP address of the MySQL server machine. The default if 'localhost'.

public boolean checkForAdminDatabase()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Check that the Compendium administration database for this MySQL database application exists.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.FileNotFoundException

checkAdminDatabase

public boolean checkAdminDatabase()
                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Check that the Compendium administration database for this MySQL database application exists. If not, it must be the first time Compendium is being used with this MySQL database application, so create it.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

isAdministrator

public boolean isAdministrator(java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                               java.lang.String sLogin,
                               java.lang.String sPassword)
Add a new database with the given project and database name.

Parameters:
String - sDatabaseName, the actual database name as it is known in MySQL.
String - slogin, the users login name.
String - sPassword, the users password.
Returns:
if the the user is a valid user for the given database and is an administrator of it.
